05/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~IT'S THE SPIRIT THAT COUNTS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus says: "I will send you the Counselor - the Spirit of Truth.
He will come to you from the Father and will tell you about me.
(Jn. 15:26)

Our Lesson for Today:
Here again Jesus offers hope.The Holy Spirit gives us the strength to endure
the unreasonable hatred and evil in our world and the hostility many have toward 
Christ. ~ This is especially comforting for those facing persecution...

Jesus uses two names for the Holy Spirit ~ "Counselor" and "Spirit of Truth."
The word Counselor stands for the encouraging, and strengthening work of the Spirit.
Spirit of Truth points to the teaching, illuminating, and reminding work of the Spirit.
The Holy Spirit ministers to both the head and the heart, both dimensions are important...

God wants us to know that we are not alone. You have the Holy Spirit to comfort you, 
to teach you the truth, and help you...
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Jesus uses two names for the Holy Spirit ~ "Counselor" and "Spirit of Truth." The word Counselor stands for the encouraging, and strengthening work of the Spirit. Spirit of Truth points to the teaching, illuminating, and reminding work of the Spirit. The Holy Spirit ministers to both the head and the heart, both dimensions are important. God wants us to know that we are not alone. You have the Holy Spirit to comfort you, to teach you the truth, and help you.
original_verse_text: Jesus says: "I will send you the Counselor - the Spirit of Truth. He will come to you from the Father and will tell you about me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the gift of Your Holy Spirit who comforts, strengthens, and guides us. In the face of persecution and the unreasonable hatred of this world, we cling to the truth that we are not alone. Your Spirit, the Counselor and Spirit of Truth, ministers to our heads and hearts, reminding us of Your love and empowering us to endure. We thank You for this precious promise, and we ask that Your Spirit would continue to work mightily in our lives. Amen.

05/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~NO LONGER ORPHANS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus said, "I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.
Before long, the world will not see me any more, but you will
see me. Because I live you also will live." (Jn. 14:18, 19)

Our lesson for Today:
Sometimes people wish they knew the future so they could prepare for it.
God has chosen not to give us this knowledge. He alone knows what will happen.
But He tells us all we need to know to prepare for the future. When we live by His 
standards, He will not leave us; He will come to us, and show Himself to us...

God knows what will happen, and because He will be with us through it all, We
need not fear. We don't have to know the future to have faith in God; BUT we have 
to have faith in God to be secure about the future...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for sending the Spirit to assure
me that I am Yours and You are mine...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Sometimes people wish they knew the future so they could prepare for it. God has chosen not to give us this knowledge. He alone knows what will happen. But He tells us all we need to know to prepare for the future. When we live by His standards, He will not leave us; He will come to us, and show Himself to us. God knows what will happen, and because He will be with us through it all, We need not fear. We don't have to know the future to have faith in God; BUT we have to have faith in God to be secure about the future.
original_verse_text: Jesus said, "I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you. Before long, the world will not see me any more, but you will see me. Because I live you also will live."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that You alone know the future and the plans You have for us. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding. Guide us in Your paths, and may Your presence be our constant companion, even when the way ahead is uncertain. For we know that You will never leave us nor forsake us, but will come to us and reveal Yourself to us. In Your steadfast love, we find our security and peace. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes people wish they knew the future so they could prepare for it. God has chosen not to give us this knowledge. He alone knows what will happen. But He tells us all we need to know to prepare for the future. When we live by His standards, He will not leave us; He will come to us, and show Himself to us. God knows what will happen, and because He will be with us through it all, We need not fear. We don't have to know the future to have faith in God; BUT we have to have faith in God to be secure about the future.
subject: Trusting God's Plan for Your Future

05/04/2010~~~food for thought~~~STOPPING TO VIEW HIS ASCENSION

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus said, "When the Holy Spirit has come upon you, you will receive power 
and will tell people about me everywhere ~ in Jerusalem, throughout Judea, 
in Samaria, and to the ends of The earth." It was not long after He said this that
He was taken up into the sky while they were watching, and He disappeared into 
a cloud. (Acts 1:8, 9)

Our Lesson for Today:
The power from the Holy Spirit is not limited to strength beyond the ordinary. That 
power also involves courage, boldness, confidence, insight, ability, and authority.
The disciples would need all these gifts to fulfill their mission. If you believe in
Jesus Christ as Your Savior, you can also experience the power of the Holy Spirit
in your life...

Remember witnessing is not showing what we can do for God. ~ It is showing and
telling what God has done for us...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, let Your ascension remind me Your
mission is done while mine is only begun...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: The power from the Holy Spirit is not limited to strength beyond the ordinary. That power also involves courage, boldness, confidence, insight, ability, and authority. The disciples would need all these gifts to fulfill their mission. If you believe in Jesus Christ as Your Savior, you can also experience the power of the Holy Spirit in your life. Remember witnessing is not showing what we can do for God. ~ It is showing and telling what God has done for us.
original_verse_text: Jesus said, "When the Holy Spirit has come upon you, you will receive power and will tell people about me everywhere ~ in Jerusalem, throughout Judea, in Samara, and to the ends of The earth." It was not long after He said this that He was taken up into the sky while they were watching, and He disappeared into a cloud.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the power of Your Holy Spirit that You have promised to those who believe in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Fill us with courage, boldness, and confidence to be Your witnesses, sharing the good news of what You have done for us through Your Son's sacrifice and resurrection. Grant us the insight, ability, and authority to fulfill the mission You have set before us, not by our own strength, but by the power of Your Spirit. May we ever be mindful that our witness is not about what we can do, but about proclaiming the wondrous works You have done. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The power from the Holy Spirit is not limited to strength beyond the ordinary. That power also involves courage, boldness, confidence, insight, ability, and authority. The disciples would need all these gifts to fulfill their mission. If you believe in Jesus Christ as your Savior, you can also experience the power of the Holy Spirit in your life. Remember, witnessing is not showing what we can do for God. It is showing and telling what God has done for us.

05/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~DO YOU HEAR?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The Lord bless you and keep you. Num. 6:24

Our Lesson for Today:
Do you hear what He promises you? ~ Just think of it! ~ 
He who keeps the whole world running and the whole
human race alive, promises that He will especially bless
and keep you...

"We are the apple of [His] eye," He reminds us in (Ps. 17:8)
"The sheep of His pasture" (Ps. 100:3)

What can be more precious to Him than those whom He has 
made His beloved children in Christ?

What can be more wonderful than what the triune God offers
"[I will] bless you and keep you."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank you for watching over and providing for such
an unworthy creature like me...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

What can be more wonderful than what the tribune God offers "[I will] bless you and keep you."

prayer: Heavenly Father, we are in awe of Your promises to bless and keep us, Your beloved children. You watch over us with the care of a shepherd tending his flock, and we are the apple of Your eye. Fill us with gratitude for Your unwavering love and protection, that we may walk confidently in the assurance of Your abiding presence. We trust in Your faithful care, Lord. Amen.

05/06/2010~~~food for thought~~~PARDON UNDESERVED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The Lord make His face to shine upon you and be
gracious to you... (Num. 6:25)

Our Lesson for Today:
Do we really deserve God's love? ~ Shouldn't God be sending the flashing
look of righteous anger our way with eyes of holy wrath? ~ How come punishment,
well deserved because of our sin, becomes pardon, fully given? ~

It's because of God's Son, the second person of the wonderful Trinity. He
came to earth to fully bear the wrath of God over our sins so we can bask in the 
sunshine of His forgiveness. ~ Because the lightning bolt of God's righteous
anger over our sins struck Jesus, we can see Him looking down on us with His 
marvelous love...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, shine upon me with the pardon purchased
by Your love. I need this sunshine daily... Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to he father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Do we really deserve God's love? ~ Shouldn't God be sending the flashing look of righteous anger our way with eyes of holy wrath? ~ How come punishment, well deserved because of our sin, becomes pardon, fully given? ~ It's because of God's Son, the second person of the wonderful Trinity. He came to earth to fully bear the wrath of God over our sins so we can bask in the sunshine of His forgiveness. ~ Because the lightning bolt of God's righteous anger over our sins struck Jesus, we can see Him looking down on us with His marvelous love.
original_verse_text: The Lord make His face to shine upon you and be gracious to you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your unfathomable love and mercy. Though we deserve Your righteous anger and judgment, You have chosen to look upon us with the radiant light of Your grace. In Your great love, You sent Your Son to bear the punishment for our sins, that we might be forgiven and receive the gift of eternal life. We are humbled by the sunshine of Your compassion, which shines upon us despite our unworthiness. May we ever bask in the warmth of Your steadfast love. Amen.

He came to earth to fully bear the wrath of God over our sins so we can bask in the sunshine of His forgiveness. ~ Because the lightning bolt of God's righteous anger over our sins struck Jesus, we can see Him looking down on us with His marvelous love.

05/07/2010~~~food for thought~~~A TRUE PEACE !!!

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The Lord turn His face toward you and give
you peace...Num. 6:26

Our Lesson for Today:
Peace !!! ~ That's what brought Christ down from His throne of glory to
a cross of shame. Peace !!! ~ That's what Christ has prepared for all people...

No !!! ~ Not peace as the world understands it. Not an end to rocket rattling 
and nuclear threats. Not an end to racial tensions and relatives' bickering.
Not an end to cold-blooded killings in the street or more sanitary murders of
the unborn in the womb...

Such outward peace could very well come IF everyone had God's true peace
in his or her heart... When the Lord promises peace, He means the real thing
Peace with Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, give me Your peace for Jesus' sake
and through the Spirit's work...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

When the Lord promises peace, He means the real thing Peace with Him.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the peace that Christ has brought through His sacrifice on the cross. Grant us the true peace that comes from reconciliation with You, not the temporary peace of the world. May Your face shine upon us and give us Your peace, that we may be united in Christ and live in harmony with one another. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.

05/08/2010 ~~~ food for thought~~~HANG ON !!!

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I am coming quickly. hold on to what you have, so that no one
will take away your crown...(Rev. 3:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experience, and maturity.
God doesn't expect us all to be and act the same, but He does
expect us to "hold on" to what we have, to persevere in using our
resources for Him...

If you are a new believer, and feel your faith and spiritual strength 
are little, use what you have to live for Christ, and God will commend 
you...

If you want to hang on to the crown, you need to hang on to God's Word
through which His Spirit strengthens the grip of faith...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, strengthen my faith through Your Word
so I can stand in heaven's victory circle...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experience, and maturity. God doesn't expect us all to be and act the same, but He does expect us to "hold on" to what we have, to persevere in using our resources for Him. If you are a new believer, and feel your faith and spiritual strength are little, use what you have to live for Christ, and God will commend you. If you want to hang on to the crown, you need to hang on to God's Word through which His Spirit strengthens the grip of faith.
original_verse_text: I am coming quickly. hold on to what you have, so that no one will take away your crown.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the diverse gifts and abilities You have graciously bestowed upon Your people. Help us to hold fast to the faith You have entrusted to us, and to use our unique resources faithfully in service to You. May we persevere in Your Word, that our spiritual strength may grow, and that we may receive the crown of life. We ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

05/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~WORSHIP WITH HEART AND MIND...

The verse I am sending to you today was sent to me yesterday as home-work by a faithful
cousin. She gives me a verse or two each day and it being Sunday today I thought it was a 
fitting verse for the day...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus said, "These People honor me with there lips, but their hearts are far away. 
Their worship is a farce, for they replace God's commands with their own man-made
teachings." (Mt. 15:8, 9)

Our Lesson for Today:
If you go to Isa. 29:13 you will see that Isaiah criticized the hypocrites of his day, and
Jesus applied Isaiah's words to the religious leaders he came into contact with...

You don't have to look to hard to see the very same kind of people today. When we
claim to honor God while our heart is far from Him, our worship means nothing. It is not
enough to act religious. Our actions and attitudes must be sincere. If they are not Jesus
and Isaiah's words also describe us...

It is not enough to study about religion or even to study the Bible. We must respond to 
God Himself...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to be filled with the love of Jesus
so that I may remain faithful in doing Your will...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Our actions and attitudes must be sincere. If they are not Jesus and Isaiah's words also describe us. It is not enough to study about religion or even to study the Bible. We must respond to God Himself.
original_verse_text: Jesus said, "These People honor me with there lips, but their hearts are far away. Their worship is a farce, for they replace God's commands with their own man-made teachings."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the deceitfulness of our own hearts. We confess that at times, our worship and devotion have been mere outward expressions, while our hearts have been far from You. Forgive us, Lord, for the hypocrisy that so easily creeps into our lives. Help us to seek You with sincerity, to respond to Your Word with obedience, and to honor You in both our words and our actions. May our lives be a true reflection of the love and devotion we claim to have for You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: If you go to Isaiah 29:13, you will see that Isaiah criticized the hypocrites of his day, and Jesus applied Isaiah's words to the religious leaders he came into contact with. 05/10/2010~~~food for thought~~~DOCTOR IN THE HOUSE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralyzed man,
"My son, your sins are forgiven." (Mk. 2:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
Before saying to the man, "Get up," Jesus said, "Your sins are forgiven." To the Jewish leaders 
this statement was blasphemous, claiming to do something only God could do. According to the 
law, the punishment for this sin was death. (Lev. 24:15, 16)...

The Jewish leaders understood correctly that Jesus was claiming a divine position, but their
judgment of Him was wrong. Jesus was not blaspheming because His claim was true. Jesus
is God, and He proved it by healing the paralyzed man. (Mk. 2:9-12)...

So as we pray for those for whom the doctor says, "There is no hope." Let us pray, 
"We commend this brother/sister into Your care and keeping." For there is always
hope in the Lord...(Mk. 5:35, 36) 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, our Divine Physician, dispense the medicine
of Your forgiveness and heal my heart every day...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

According to the law, the punishment for this sin was death. (Leviticus 24:15, 16). The Jewish leaders understood correctly that Jesus was claiming a divine position, but their judgment of Him was wrong. Jesus was not blaspheming because His claim was true. Jesus is God, and He proved it by healing the paralyzed man. (Mark 2:9-12). So as we pray for those for whom the doctor says, "There is no hope." Let us pray, "We commend this brother/sister into Your care and keeping." For there is always hope in the Lord. (Mark 5:35, 36)
original_verse_text: Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralyzed man, "My son, your sins are forgiven."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that You alone have the power to forgive sins and restore the broken. Just as Jesus forgave the paralyzed man, we pray that You would extend Your grace and healing to those who are in need of Your divine touch. May they find hope in Your unwavering love and the promise of new life in You. We trust in Your sovereign plan, for there is always hope in the Lord. Amen.

05/11/2010~~~food for thought~~~HIDDEN MANNA AND A WHITE STONE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Anyone who is willing to hear should listen to the Spirit and understand what
the Spirit is saying to the churches. Everyone who is victorious will eat of the 
manna that has been hidden away in heaven. And I will give to each one a 
white stone, and on the stone will be engraved a new name that no one knows 
except the one who receives it...(Rev. 3 17)

Our Lesson for Today:
This "manna that has been hidden away in Heaven" suggests the spiritual nourishment
that the faithful believers will receive, As the believers traveled toward the Promised Land.
God provided manna from heaven for their physical nourishment (Ex. 16:13-18).

Jesus has the bread of life (Jn. 6:51), He provides spiritual nourishment that satisfies our 
deepest hunger...

The stones are significant because each will bear the new name of every person who
truly believes in Christ. They are the evidence that a person has been accepted by God
and declared worthy to receive eternal life...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord and Savior, feed me. Assure me of God's 
"Not guilty" verdict as only you can...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

God provided manna from heaven for their physical nourishment (Exodus 16:13-18). Jesus has the bread of life (John 6:51), He provides spiritual nourishment that satisfies our deepest hunger. The stones are significant because each will bear the new name of every person who truly believes in Christ. They are the evidence that a person has been accepted by God and declared worthy to receive eternal life.
original_verse_text: "Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who is victorious, I will give some of the hidden manna. I will also give that person a white stone with a new name written on it known only to the one who receives it."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the spiritual nourishment You provide through Your Son, the Bread of Life. Just as You sustained the Israelites with manna in the wilderness, may we feed on the hidden manna of Your Word and the new name You have for each of us. May we find our deepest satisfaction in You alone, and may our lives be a testament to Your acceptance and the promise of eternal life. Amen.
reflection: This "manna that has been hidden away in Heaven" suggests the spiritual nourishment that the faithful believers will receive. As the believers traveled toward the Promised Land, God provided manna from heaven for their physical nourishment (Exodus 16:13-18). Jesus is the bread of life (John 6:51); He provides spiritual nourishment that satisfies our deepest hunger. The stones are significant because each will bear the new name of every person who truly believes in Christ. 05/12/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT A STAR!!!

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"They will have the same authority I received from My Father,
and I will also give them the morning star! (Rev. 2:28)

Our Lesson for Today:
The morning star is the one who rules the sky with royal splendor. So does Jesus.
He who has won the victory over sin, death, and hell now rules over everything. His
name is above every name; to Him every knee must bow...

When He takes all who believe in Him to heaven, we'll not only see His glorious

05/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~DO YOU HAVE THE KEY???

Our Bible Verse for Today:
These are the words of Him who is holy and true, who holds the key of David. 
What He opens no one can shut, and what He shuts no one can open. (Rev. 3:7)

Our Lesson for Today:
When it comes to heaven's door, Scripture leaves no doubt as to who holds the key.
In fact, He is the key. He and He alone opens the door to heaven... 

On that cross centuries ago, He who is holy and true, He who is the priceless Son of God, 
suffered and died. He didn't deserve to die; we did. He carried our guilt, not His own. He 
who had no sin fully paid the penalty for each of our sins...

Like a key the Savior opened the door of heaven. And it stands open until He closes it.
Be sure to heed the warning in these words. Are you merely standing before the cross 
of Christ or are you kneeling in humble faith beneath it?

May God's grace keep Jesus, the key, in the pocket of your faith always...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for faith's hand that holds
Jesus as my key to heaven...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

05/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~PERMANENT PILLARS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
(Rev. 3:12) in capsule form: Him who overcomes I will make a pillar 
in the temple of My God. Never again will he leave it.

Our Lesson for Today:
When Jesus describes believers in heaven as "pillars in the temple of my God,"
there's nothing sad about His words. It's a glorious picture, a comforting thought.
Here on earth we seem to be blown about by every wind that comes along. Some 
days those winds seem like tornadoes against which believers have little protection...

The sins they fall into daily, the temptations they face daily, the struggle with defects 
sin has brought into the world whip them about as if there were no safety...

But there is!!! He who has prepared my salvation promises to protect my soul. He
who brings me peace with God will not let the world rob me of it. He said He will keep
me until His eternal day ~ and He will keep His word. My loving Savior even promises 
that He will make me into a pillar in heaven...

Now that's something to look forward to! BUT only for those who by God's grace know
His Son Jesus as their Savior...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, keep me safe in faith in Jesus as my only 
Savior from sin till I stand in Your heaven...Amen.
In awe of Him ~ Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

05/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE ONLY DETERGENT THAT WORKS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
And the blood of Jesus, His Son, purifies us from all sin... (I Jn. 1:7)

Our Lesson for Today:
In our verse, John writes about the dirt of sin, the grime of daily life that is ground into our souls.
He speaks about the mud of sinful birth and sinful life that soils everyone, making us fit only for
hell...

BUT then he also points us to the only detergent that can wash sin's stain completely out of our
souls. That's the precious blood of Jesus, God's Son. His blood doesn't just brush off sin's outward 
stain but removes it completely. It doesn't leave any ugly residue but lifts it out totally...

How is this possible? It is because that blood comes from the veins of Him who is not only man but 
God from all eternity. God who promised forgiveness is faithful. At Calvary's cross we see that He did 
not merely sweep sin under the carpet but demanded full payment from His Son as our substitute...

That Son's suffering and death is the miracle whitener that cleanses even the most corrupt sinner and 
the most crimson stain.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You that I can say, "Grace and life eternal 
in that blood I find; Blest be His compassion, infinitely kind." Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

05/16/2010 ~~~ food for thought ~~~ THE GIFT ONLY GOD COULD GIVE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. (I Jn. 5:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
"God has given us eternal life," John writes. Life with God is not something we can earn.
It's not payment for our deeds, or a prize we deserve. Only one word fits ~ gift. Only one
could give this gift ~ God. He looked down on us, born dead in unbelief, bound for eternal
death in hell's dungeon, and had pity on is. With amazing love He prepared for us a life that 
never ends...

This life is in His Son, nowhere else can we find life with God but in His Son. Only God's
Son could fill the cross, feel hell's pangs, fling open death's grave, and make it count for
us. The price for life with God was so steep that only God Himself could handle it...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for the life that brings me joy
on earth and eternity at Your side...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verse for Today:
By His boundless mercy God has given us the privilege of
being born again... (I Pet. 1:3b) 

Our Lesson for Today:
Do you need encouragement? ~~~ Peter's words offer joy and hope in
times of trouble, and he bases his confidence on what God has done
for us in Christ Jesus...

We live with the wonderful expectation of eternal life (vs. 3). Our hope
is not only for the future, eternal life begins when we trust Christ and 
join God's family...

No matter what pain or trial we face in this life, we know that it is not our
final experience. Eventually we will live with Christ forever...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, every day take me back to Christ's
resurrection as proof for all Your promises...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

05/19/2010 ~~~food for thought~~~HIS HAND IS STRONG ENOUGH...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you. (I Pet. 5:7)

Our Lesson for Today:
I think it goes without saying that each one of us knows something about anxiety.
Why is this something we all struggle with? ~~~ Because we are all sinners. Born 
with sinful hearts, inherited from sinful parents, so we surely must fear the just
anger of a holy God...

Add to those hearts our many daily sins of thought, word and deed, and see how
the fear of that holy God must increase. Now as if this weren't enough, we also have 
the troubles brought into this world when our first parents sinned...

So who's going to hold us? ~~~ "Jesus," Peter tells us. ~~~ And he tells us why. ~~~
It's because "He cares for us." His powerful hands were once stretched out on the cross
for us. ~~~ Those same hands are now stretched around you and me by One who rose 
from the grave to show that the debt of sin was paid, death was defeated, and heaven opened.

Those same hands will be there to carry every believer when it's time to enter heaven's door.
"He cares for you." Peter says. ~~~ He can hold us in the palm of His hand with no trouble
at all...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, hold me by the hand, and lead me safely home...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

05/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~BOLD BEGGARS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
So, let us come boldly to the throne of grace with confidence, so that we 
may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our times of need...(Heb. 4:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
Prayer is our approach to God, and we are to come "boldly with confidence."
Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask Him
to meet their needs. ~ Others pray flippantly, giving little thought to what they
say...

Let us come with reverence because He is our King. But also come with bold
assurance because He is our Friend and Counselor...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, hear my prayers for Jesus' sake.
Grant me forgiveness and peace...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verse for Today:
You have come to mount Zion, to the heavenly Jerusalem,
the city of the living God... Heb. 12:22

Our Lesson for Today:
Let's not forget that every Christian is a citizen of the heavenly Jerusalem ~
even now; because Christ rules in our lives, the Holy Spirit is always with
us, and we experience close fellowship with other believers...

Thank God we have a traveling companion, not jus one with whom to share
the sights but one who keeps us on the road. That's our Savior, Jesus Christ
whose death and resurrection make Him the road to Mount Zion...

The full and ultimate rewards and reality of the heavenly Jerusalem are
depicted in Rev. 21... This would make for a good private lesson...

Dear Lord, through the gospel, keep my feet
on the path to Jesus, the road home...Amen.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that we are citizens of the heavenly Jerusalem, where Christ rules and the Holy Spirit abides with us. We rejoice that we have a Savior, Jesus Christ, who is the road to Mount Zion and secures our ultimate reward in Your presence. May we ever keep our eyes fixed on the eternal realities to come, even as we journey through this world. Amen.
reflection: Let's not forget that every Christian is a citizen of the heavenly Jerusalem, even now, because Christ rules in our lives, the Holy Spirit is always with us, and we experience close fellowship with other believers. Thank God we have a traveling companion, not just one with whom to share the sights but one who keeps us on the road. That's our Savior, Jesus Christ, whose death and resurrection make Him the road to Mount Zion. The full and ultimate rewards and reality of the heavenly Jerusalem are depicted in Revelation 21. This would make for a good private lesson.
subject: Heavenly Citizenship: Christ's Presence Guides Us

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I'm not saying that I have achieved my goal or that I have already reached perfection!
But I keep working toward that day when I will finally be all that Christ Jesus saved me
for and wants me to be... (Phil. 3:12)

Our Lesson for Today:
Paul had said that his goal was to know Christ, ~ to be like Christ, ~ and to be all Christ
had in mind for him. ~ This goal took all of Paul's energies...

What a wonderful example for us. We should not allow anything to take our eyes off our goal ~ 
that of knowing Christ. With the single-mindedness of an athlete in training, we must lay aside
everything harmful and forsake anything that may distract us from being effective Christians.
What is holding you back???

the road home to heaven...Amen.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Let us not neglect our meeting together, as some do, but encourage
and warn each other, especially now that the day of His coming back
again is drawing near...(Heb. 10:25)

Our Lesson for Today:
To neglect Christian meetings is to give up the encouragement and help
of other Christians. Christians should be gathering together to share their 
faith and to strengthen one another in the Lord...

As we get closer to the day when Christ will return, we will face many spiritual 
struggles, and even times of persecution. Anti-Christian forces will grow in 
strength. Difficulties should never be excuses for missing church services.
Rather, as difficulties arise, we should make an even greater effort to be faithful 
in attendance...

Dear Lord, help me in the difficulties of this life so that
I will remain faithful to you and the gathering of my Christian
friends...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

05/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~TIME TO MAKE AN HONEST EVALUATION OF OUR LIFE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
It is a trustworthy statement, deserving full acceptance, that Christ Jesus came
into the world to save sinners, among whom I am foremost of all. (I Tim. 1:15)

Our Lesson for Today:
If I were to write the story of my life, I would have to start as Paul did ~
making a full confession, "I am the worst of sinners." Such a confession 
is not easy to make. How is it that everything else we like to exaggerate,
but our sins we like to shrink?

Other people's sins we can easily spot, but our own somehow escape detection.
But the plain truth remains that we are all sinners. And I'll be the first to confess 
that I don't need a microscope to examine my daily life. Sin's contamination is
clearly visible...

Thank God for the fact that, "Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners."
Because of Him God won't write the word lost over my grave, but saved by His 
grace in Christ Jesus. Because of this no more needs to be said in the story of
my life...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, let it be said of me that "Chief of sinners
though I be, Jesus shed His blood of me." Amen...
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Like the apostle Paul, we confess that we are the worst of sinners, unable to hide the contamination of sin in our lives. Yet, we are grateful that Your Son, Jesus Christ, came into this world to save us, to redeem us by His sacrifice on the cross. Lord, may we never forget the depth of Your love and the power of Your forgiveness, that through faith in Christ, we may be counted among the saved, not the lost. We give You all the glory and praise. Amen.

05/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~ARE YOU CERTAIN OF YOUR ETERNAL DESTINY?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
For to me, to live is Christ, and to die is gain...(Phil. 1:21)

Our Lesson for Today:
Someone once wrote, "Christ is not valued at all unless He is valued
above all." Isn't that what Paul is trying to say to me?

God has given me life so that I might have life's greatest treasure.
All of the world's stocks and bonds can't bring the peace I have in Jesus.
The best house in Greenbush, Mn. looks like some falling-down shack 
compared to my Father's house in heaven...

YES when by faith I have Christ, I have it all. When the Savior dwells in my
heart, the purpose for life is fulfilled. God gives me life, long or short, so that
by His grace I might know Jesus as my only Savior...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for bringing the Savior into my heart.
Keep Him there always...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

05/26/2010 ~~~food for thought~~~OUR LIVES WORK FOR CHRIST...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Paul writes, "It has become clear throughout the whole palace guard and 
to everyone else that I am in chains for Christ..." (Phil. 1:13)

Our Lesson for Today:
Paul could no longer plant new mission congregations and prepare more mission workers,
But he could still talk about Jesus, and he did. Every six to eight hours another guard would
come to relieve the guard whom Paul was chained...

There is no telling how many guards Paul told about Jesus during his two years in custody 
at Rome. The laugh's on Satan who thought that chaining Paul up would curtail his preaching
of Christ. But Paul used it as another opportunity to work for Christ...

We need to remember that it is not just the pastor who has a pulpit from which to preach
Christ, so do we. Our pulpit is called daily life. Our walk is heavenward, but on the way 
there's work for us to do...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, make me a faithful witness to the Savior so
that others may walk with me to heaven...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

05/27/2010~~~food for thought~~~ARE YOU WILLING TO SUFFER FOR CHRIST?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
For I live in eager expectation and hope that I will never do anything that causes me
shame, but that I will always be bold for Christ, as I have been in the past, and that
my life will always honor Christ, whether I live or die...(Phil. 1:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
To have Christ and to work for Christ ~ that's what life is all about. ~ Right? ~ Of course!

But will everyone nod their heads approvingly if we add that in life believers are called 
upon to suffer for Christ? Paul would...

As of yet in our country there's no danger of losing our heads because of our faith. But our
problem to often is that we hide our heads because of our faith, when all around us people
are foolishly saying that truth is what you want to believe. It takes Christian fortitude to
preach that only what God's Word says is true...

When matters like morals, marriage, and life's meaning flip-flop every other day, it requires
strong faith to stand up for what God has said in His unchanging Word...

Remember Those who rely on God's free grace in Christ Jesus, God's power to take care
of their lives, and God's wisdom to lead correctly will along with Paul, have what it takes to
suffer for Christ...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I am weak, but You are strong, be with me...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

05/28/2010~~~food for thought~~~THERE IS NOTHING WE CAN DO TO EARN SALVATION,
MERELY ACCEPT WHAT CHRIST HAS ALREADY DONE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
God has chosen the foolish things of the world to shame the wise,
and God has chosen the weak things of the world to shame the things
which are strong...( I Cor. 1:27)

Our Lesson for Today:
Is Christianity against rational thinking? Of course not!!!
Christians do believe in using their minds to weigh the evidence and
make wise choices...

Paul is saying that no amount of human knowledge can replace or bypass 
Christ's work on the cross. If it could, Christ would be accessible only to
the intellectually gifted and well educated and not to ordinary people or to 
children...

In vs. 28-31 Paul goes on to say that the way to receive salvation is so simple
that any person who wants to can understand it. Skill and wisdom do not get
a person into God's kingdom ~ simple faith does...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, in a dying world, fill my heart with
the joy of knowing that to die is gain...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Skill and wisdom do not get a person into God's kingdom ~ simple faith does.

We thank You that Your wisdom surpasses human understanding, and that You have chosen the weak and foolish things of this world to shame the wise. Help us to rely on Your grace, not our own abilities, and to humbly receive the gift of eternal life through faith in Your Son. Amen.

05/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~DON'T LEAVE GOD OUT OF YOUR LABOR~DAY CELEBRATIONS

Our Bible Verses for Today: (Thanks to cousin Donna)
And He [God] has given Him [Jesus] authority to judge mankind
because He is the Son of Man...(Jn. 6:27)
And all who believe this will keep themselves pure, just as Christ is pure...(I Jn. 3:3)

Our Lesson for Today:
Isn't it neat how these two separate texts tie so neatly together?
We need to remember that the Christian life is a process of becoming more and more 
like Christ (Ro. 8:29). BUT this process will not be complete until we see Christ face to
face (I Cor. 13:12)...

Now knowing that this is our ultimate destiny we should be motivated to purify ourselves.
To keep pure means to keep morally straight, free from the corruption of sin...

God also purifies us, but there is an action we must take to remain morally fit.
What is that action??? James 4:8 says: Draw close to God and God will draw close to you...
James gives us five ways to accomplish this:
(1) Humble yourselves before God. (4:7)
(2) Resist the Devil. (4:7)
(3) Lead a pure life. (4:8)
(4) Let there be sorrow and deep grief for your sins. (4:9)
(5) Bow down before the Lord and He will lift you up. (4:10)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I have sinned against You in thought, word, and deed
all for which I seek Your forgiveness...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

05/31/2010~~~food for thought~~~JESUS BOTH GOD AND MAN...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us, 
and we beheld His glory, glory as of the only begotten
from the Father, full of grace and truth... (Jn. 1:14)

Our Lesson for Today:
When Jesus was born, God became a man. He was not part man and part God;
He was completely human and completely divine (Col. 2:9). Before Christ came,
people could know God partially. After Christ came, people could know God
fully because He became visible and tangible in Christ...

Christ is the perfect expression of God in human form. The two most common 
errors people make about Jesus are to minimize His humanity or to minimize
His divinity. Remember Jesus is both God and man. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Christ is the perfect expression of God in human form. The two most common errors people make about Jesus are to minimize His humanity or to minimize His divinity. Remember Jesus is both God and man.
original_verse_text: And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, glory as of the only begotten from the Father, full of grace and truth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we marvel at the mystery of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who took on human flesh and dwelt among us. He, being fully God, did not cling to His divine privileges, but humbled Himself, becoming obedient to the point of death on a cross. Help us to grasp the depth of Your love, that You would send Your only begotten Son to become one of us, to reveal Yourself fully in human form. May we worship Christ, the perfect expression of Your divine nature, and follow His example of selfless service. Amen.

06/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~PROMISES! PROMISES! PROMISES!

Our Bible Verse for Today:
As for me and my household, we will serve the Lord. (Jos. 24:15)

Our Lesson for Today:
Remember the promises we made at our weddings?
In this month when many marriages occur, we might do well to review those promises.
Even more so, we might want to look at the promises behind successful and enduring marriages...

BUT this text wants us to examine how it has gone with our promise to serve the Lord...

Unless the Lord in His grace reminds us what He has done for us, we can't even begin to serve Him.
When sin bends our spirits in marriage, how can we turn to Him for relief unless we know Him to 
be the Lord who assures us, "Take heart,...your sins are forgiven" (Mt. 9:2)?

Before we can serve the Lord in our marriage, we need to remember what He has done for us...

The secret to serving the Lord is to let Him serve us. When His Word dwells in our homes richly,
His pardon in Christ Jesus will cheer our hearts and empower our lives. Joyful service to Him will
follow. So will remembering and renewing the promises we made to each other on our wedding days...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I long to walk closer to You. Feed me
with Your Word so that I can...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

original_verse_text: As for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, remembering the promises we have made to You and to one another. In Your great love and mercy, You have forgiven our sins and given us new life in Christ. May Your Word dwell richly in our homes, that we may be empowered to joyfully serve You and one another. Help us to renew the vows we have made, that our marriages may be a reflection of Your steadfast love. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
